page.title: 12HOUSING IN CAISTOR
page.content: Caistor Market Place is the hub of the small town & is very busy on a Saturday.The open square is used for car parking and contains a water pump dated 1897.The buildings around the square & town centre give the town its character.There are two and three storey buildings,creating an uneven skyline,the roofing material being characteristically red,local pantiles. Walls are mostly brick,but many are painted in pastel colours.The rooms above the shops are flats. Central Caistor is a{conservation {area}with many listed buildings. Newer,detached and semi detached properties have been built since 1950, mainly on Kelsey Rd.,Navigation lane, and Spa Top.{A new(1985)development}of detached houses & bungalows is under construcion by Edwards builders at the western end of Navigation lane.
